alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Miguel County; Harding County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 5:11PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL AND SOUTH CENTRAL HARDING COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM MDT... At 510 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 20 miles east of Conchas Dam, or 20 miles south of Mosquero, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central San Miguel and south central Harding Counties. This includes State Road 104 near Mile Marker 94. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Miguel County; Harding County
